title: How I Finally Memorized Modifier Ordering in Compose
description: For the longest time, I proudly had no idea of how Modifier ordering works, and would just guess and then guess again when something didn't look quite right. Here's how I finally ended up remembering how the ordering works.

title: SimpleCamera
description: Simple Camera is a library that allows you to use cameras in a simplified, easy, fast and effective way. It contains CameraX as an internal library. It simplifies the camera features used by CameraX and provides ease of use with a single library. As updates come on the CameraX side, the library will try to stay up to date. Missing features will be added soon. Like video capturing.

It looks exciting and I want it to succeed. At the same time, I‚Äôve learned to be cautiously optimistic about hot-reload solutions. The dream of hot-reloadable android code is old ‚Äî and frankly, cold. [‚Ä¶] The post The pursuit of fast feedback loops appeared first on Saket Narayan.

title: Building a sub-sampling image viewer for Compose UI
description: How do you display a 100mb image on Android without running into OutOfMemoryError? You can‚Äôt. But you can cheat. For years Android developers have used Dave Morrissey‚Äôs excellent library, subsampling-scale-image-view for displaying large bitmaps with deep zoom. It optimizes memory usage by loading lower resolution bitmaps whenever possible and avoiding loading parts of the original [‚Ä¶] The post Building a sub-sampling image viewer for Compose UI appeared first on Saket Narayan.

title: Back it up, bring it back: No data left behind
description: It can be a draw when setting up a new device. Some info transfers, while some don‚Äôt. Learn how developers can ensure the best user experience when people backup and restore an Android device. Hosts Tor and Chet are joined by Graham and Piyush on the Android Consumer Experience team¬† and Alon on the Android Studio team to discuss Android backup and restore. ¬† Chapters: 0:00 - Introduction & the user pain point 1:38 - Why backup fails: Developer challenges 4:00 - Evolution of backup testing: From scripts to Android Studio 7:15 - Beyond testing: Backup for developer workflow 8:50 - Cross-device backup & GMS core integration 10:55 - Understanding backup types: Devices vs. Cloud 14:55 - Data categories & developer control 16:05 - System-level backup: Permissions & credentials 18:35 - Default backup pitfalls & key-value agents 28:15 - Database migrations & backup stress testing 32:04 - Automated testing framework 41:02 - Recap & feedback channels

title: Bot to the Future: Two Years Later
description: Join Tor and Siva Velusamy and Sandhya Mohan from the Android Studio team to learn about the latest updates to Studio Bot (Gemini in Android Studio) that dropped at Google I/O 2025 including Agent Mode. Building on their conversation from two years ago about the Studio Bot, they explore Gemini‚Äôs role in every stage of development, from design to building, testing, and maintenance, the future of coding companions, and more. title: Android Weekly Issue #683
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored üöÄ Faster Android app releases with automated QA Manual testing on Android is slow, fragmented, and unreliable‚Äîand without broad device coverage, critical bugs slip through. QA Wolf delivers 80% automated coverage in weeks, running tests on high-fidelity Android emulators with full gesture, sensor, and visual support. Tests run in 100% parallel with zero flakes‚Äîso you can release faster, with confidence. Learn more. Improve Your Kotlin Code Quality with Detekt in Android Anand‚ÄØGaur demonstrates using Detekt and custom rules in Android projects to enforce clean, maintainable Kotlin code. Android Text-to-Speech: The Ultimate Guide Ashiq Fury explains how to implement advanced TTS features‚Äîpause, resume, and word highlighting‚Äîin Android apps. Modular Ktor: Building Backends for Scale Learn how modularizing Ktor services enhances backend scalability, testability, and development efficiency. Sleeping But Working: Cross-Platform Background Sync with KMP Learn about setting up cross-platform background sync in KMP using Android WorkManager and iOS BGTaskScheduler. How to Build a Stunning Animated Progress Button Jyotimoy Kashyap shows how to animate a button‚Äôs fill progress in Jetpack Compose for better user feedback. üîç Stop Guessing, Start Measuring: DIY App Performance Tracing Akniyet‚ÄØArysbayev outlines creating a DIY tracing system to measure app performance accurately using Systrace and custom traces. SnapshotFlow or collectAsState? How to pick the right tool for Jetpack Compose Dmitry Glazunov explains that collectAsState suits direct UI state updates, while snapshotFlow is better for capturing Compose state changes into Flows for smoother UI handling. Compose Multiplatform + Ktor: Secure Networking Arul mani outlines configuring Ktor with shared networking code and bearer auth across Compose Multiplatform targets. Now in Android #119 This edition covers Android 16, Desktop Experiences, Adaptive Apps, Testing Videos, AndroidX and more! It's All About (Accessibility) Focus And Compose Eevis Panula clarifies accessibility vs keyboard focus in Compose and advises on managing focus and traversal for better user experience. Nested Scrolling in Jetpack Compose by Victor Brandalise Victor Brandalise explains how to coordinate scrolling in nested Compose layouts for smoother interaction. Using Google's Agent Development Kit for Java from Kotlin code John O‚ÄôReilly shows how to use Google‚Äôs ADK Java toolkit from Kotlin‚Äîcovering Gradle setup, Gemini model configuration, AI agent tooling, and the developer UI. Place a sponsored post Advertise to more than 80k Android developers! We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development related service or product! Libraries & Code LazyTimetable A high-performance, lazy-loading timetable composable for Android Jetpack Compose. MBCompass MBCompass is a simple yet feature-rich compass app for Android, built with Jetpack Compose. android-mcp-sdk An Android library that integrates the MCP Kotlin SDK to enable Android applications to host MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers. News Evolving Android‚Äôs early-access programs: Introducing the Canary channel Google announces a rolling Canary channel for Android giving developers ongoing access to early builds and feedback opportunities. Transition to using 16 KB page sizes for Android apps Google urges native apps to adopt 16‚ÄØKB page sizes by Nov 1, 2025 to enhance performance and meet Android 15 requirements. Videos & Podcasts Android MCP SDK with Jason Pearson Venture in the world of AI with Jason Pearson and the Android MCP (Model Context Protocol) SDK Everything you need to know about the NEW Material's Evolution Everything you need to know about the NEW Material's Evolution Google Play PolicyBytes - July 2025 policy updates Bohdan, from Regional Operations North America, Trust and Safety, Google Play, shares important updates from our July 2025 Google Play policy announcements. Back it up, bring it back: No data left behind Hosts Tor and Chet are joined by Graham and Piyush on the Android Consumer Experience team and Alon on the Android Studio team to discuss Android backup and restore. Why & How developers should test Applications mohsenoid is joined by Vitaly Sharovatov, to dive into one of the most overlooked yet impactful practices in software development: developers testing their own code. Stateful vs. Stateless Composables In Jetpack Compose? Philipp Lackner compares Composable UI components that contain local state with remember and mutableStateOf with stateless Composables that receive UI state from the outside, typically from a ViewModel. How To Bring An Old Project To Live (Step-By-Step) Jov Mit shows step-by-step how to upgrade a 2 year old app to the latest for re-publishing in the Play store. Kotlin 2.2 Livestream With the Language Evolution Team With the release of Kotlin 2.2, the Kotlin team at JetBrains has continued its mission to improve the language even further. In this livestream, we look at the new features available in Kotlin 2.2. Android 16, testing, desktop experiences, AndroidX, and more! Meghan shares exciting news like the release of Android 16! Discover developer previews for desktop windowing experiences, building adaptive apps, and more!

title: Android Weekly Issue #682
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored üöÄ Faster Android app releases with automated QA Manual testing on Android is slow, fragmented, and unreliable‚Äîand without broad device coverage, critical bugs slip through. QA Wolf delivers 80% automated coverage in weeks, running tests on high-fidelity Android emulators with full gesture, sensor, and visual support. Tests run in 100% parallel with zero flakes‚Äîso you can release faster, with confidence. Schedule a demo. Alarmee: Schedule Local and Push Notifications in KMP Vivien Mah√© presents Alarmee, a KMP library for unified local and push notification scheduling on Android and iOS via a single shared API. How I Optimize My Android App from 15MB to under <2MB Mubarak Basha shrank his app from 15‚ÄØMB to 1.7‚ÄØMB via osmdroid replacement, R8/ProGuard with resource shrinking, and WebP asset conversion. The Current Status of Test Fixtures Support in Android Andrzej Zabost highlights that AGP‚ÄØ8.5 now supports Kotlin in Android test fixtures behind an experimental flag, improving shared test utility setup despite limited documentation. The Kotlin Flow Operator Cheat Sheet Omar offers a practical Kotlin Flow operator cheat sheet with real-world Android coroutine use cases covering essential transform, flatten, combine, buffering, and error-handling operators. Deep Dive into Jetpack Compose Text Views : The Secret Life of Composable Richa Sharma reveals how Compose optimizes Text() via compiler-generated parameters, slot tables, bitmask checks, and direct Canvas rendering. When Kotlin object Stops Being a Singleton Anatolii Frolov highlights that Kotlin object singletons can be duplicated by libraries like Gson, so custom adapters are necessary to preserve true singleton behavior when deserializing. Building a Compose Multiplatform app: Part 3 Domen Lani≈°nik enables offline caching and error handling in a Compose Multiplatform news app using SQLDelight and retry logic. Managing state across navigation in Jetpack Compose Dmitry Glazunov explains state management in Jetpack Compose using ViewModels, SavedStateHandle, CompositionLocal, rememberSaveable, and Navigation 3‚Äôs rememberNavBackStack for robust navigation and config-change handling. Migrating to Jetpack Compose Navigation 3 Stefano Natali outlines migrating to Nav3 by adopting NavKey for screen types, custom back stack management, NavDisplay, and direct back‚Äêstack manipulation in navigation actions. Firebase Studio ‚Äî Your ultimate product development toolkit Abhishek Doshi showcases Firebase Studio, a VS Code‚Äìbased AI development workspace that streamlines full-stack app creation and deployment from the browser using Gemini. Don't use Type-safe Project Accessors with Kotlin Gradle DSL Zac Sweers cautions that using type-safe project accessors in Kotlin Gradle DSL can break incremental builds due to ABI changes, recommending disabling them for better build performance. Curious case of missing Bottom Sheet Previews Saurabh Arora shows how using rememberStandardBottomSheetState makes modal bottom sheet previews visible, fixing hidden sheet issues during Jetpack Compose screenshot tests. Place a sponsored post Advertise to more than 80k Android developers! We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development related service or product! Libraries & Code alarmee A Kotlin/Compose Multiplatform library to schedule alarms, display local notifications, and handle push notifications on Android and iOS. News Google Play's Indie Games Fund in Latin America returns for its 4th year Google announces a $2M Indie Games Fund in Latin America supporting 10 studios ($150K‚Äì$200K each); apply by July‚ÄØ31,‚ÄØ2025, early entries by July‚ÄØ15 preferred. Get ready for the next generation of gameplay powered by Play Games Services Google introduces Play Games Services v2 with improved achievements, promotions, seamless sign‚Äëin, and AI avatars, urging developers to migrate by May‚ÄØ2026. Videos & Podcasts Embedded Layout Inspector | Jetpack Compose Tips This walkthrough breaks down how to access the Embedded Layout Inspector in Android Studio, navigate its features like the Component Tree and Attributes Panel, and make the most of tools like Deep Inspect. FFmpeg-Kit + 16 KB Page Size In Android*üöÄ Agam‚ÄØKoradiya details building and integrating a 16‚ÄØKB-compatible FFmpeg‚ÄëKit .aar to meet Google Play‚Äôs Android‚ÄØ15+ page size requirement. June 2025: Updates to SDK and CLI, Firebase Crashlytics, and more Catch up on the latest Firebase releases from June 2025 with Cynthia, covering new ways to test your app, Firebase Crashlytics, CLI and SDK updates, and much more! Android Devs Live Stream - Coupling & Cohesion Jov Mit's live-coding stream covering architecture, rules & principles and coupling & cohesion. New Stable Android Studio, Firebender AI & More - Android News July 2025 Philipp Lackner goes over the most relevant changes of Android & KMP from June. Specials Software engineering with LLMs in 2025: reality check How are devs at AI startups and in Big Tech using AI tools, and what do they think of them? A broad overview of the state of play in tooling, with Anthropic, Google, Amazon, and others
